description: Single and two storey rear extension; pitched dormer to side roof slope; single storey rear extension to detached outbuilding; external alterations (Demolition of conservatory)
decision_conditions: <p><span style="font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; font-size: 14.6667px;">The proposed development, by reason of its considerable rearward bulk and massing would result in a harmful impact to the outlook and sense of enclose to occupiers of the adjacent dwellinghouse at no. 28 Salisbury Road to the detriment of their respective amenities and quality of habitation. As such, the development is contrary to Polices D3 of the London Plan (2021), policy CS 1 B of the harrow Core Strategy (2012) and policy DM 1 of the Harrow Development Management Policies (2013).&nbsp;</span></p><p><span style="font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; font-size: 14.6667px;"><br></span></p><p><br></p>

<p><span style="font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; font-size: 14px;">The proposed two storey rear extension and flank dormer by reason their respective massing, scale and depth would&nbsp;</span><span style="font-size: 14px;">overwhelm the host property creating an incongruous extension out of keeping with the prevailing built form in the location and failing&nbsp;to respect the host properties historical architectural character.&nbsp; As such, the development is contrary to&nbsp;</span><span style="font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; font-size: 14px;">Policies D1 and D4 of The London Plan (2021), Core Policy CS1.B of the Harrow Core Strategy (2012), Policy DM1 of the Harrow Development Management Policies Local Plan (2013) and the adopted Supplementary Planning Document: Residential Design Guide (2010).</span></p><p><span style="font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; font-size: 16px;"><br></span></p><p><br></p>
